Judul: CONCEPTUALIZING SOCIAL VALUE MEASUREMENT IN PROFIT ORGANIZATION
Abstrak:
The knowledge of how organization capture social value activity and what impact of its creation 

on organization has been widely explored in non-profit organization. However, those illustration 

in profit organization is less explored. Herein, this study particularly examines the social value 

measurement in profit organization by illustrating the relationships of three elements (1) good 

management indicators (i.e., social motives, market orientation, organizational context) (2) 

mediating element that bridge social value commitment and firm performance (i.e., social 

innovation) (3) performance outcome (i.e., organizational performance, financial performance, 

and innovation performance). Using questionnaire data from 125 managers from companies 

operating CSR in Indonesia, this study applies structural equation modelling with confirmatory 

analysis for testing and estimating the relationship of model elements. This study finds three 

important aspects. First, organizational context will directly influence other variables to strength 

the commitment capturing social value. Second, only market orientation directly affects the 

social value commitment. Third, social innovation truly mediates the commitment toward social 

value to yield firm performance. The model measurement confirms the critical view of 

organizational involvement and of social innovation capability will impact firm performance.
Kata Kunci: CSR, Social Value, Social Innovation, Firm Performance, Profit Organization, Indonesia
